text: Memes are fickle. They get old real quick, and there’s always a negative way they can be read

elements.text: Memes are fickle. They get old real quick, and there’s always a negative way they can be read

text: Agreed, one more meme coming Monday (not political) and then we take another meme hiatus

text: Going to start accepting sponsorship with dogecoin?

elements.text: Going to start accepting sponsorship with dogecoin?

text: If that was possible, we would be doing it

text: I can get behind most memes that net the Julia language $$

elements.text: I can get behind most memes that net the Julia language $$

text:
I’d agree but unless you do some a/b testing how would you know if memes are more effective than another strategy? IMO given Julia’s audience appeals that are a bit more professional would land better in general. Though not speaking for myself, 'got' the meme. 

OTOH, I wonder if it just was a bit more obviously a meme (using that big meme font I think would do it) might avoid some criticism?
